firstArticle.title: Why 80% of Content on X (Twitter) Never Reaches Its Full Potential
firstArticle.author: Martha Johnson, Head of Strategy

sections.subtitle: The Invisible Reach Barrier
sections.content: X platform (formerly Twitter) remains one of the most important communication channels for brands, influencers and content creators. However, according to our latest research, as much as 80% of all content published on this platform never reaches even 10% of its potential reach. Why is this happening? We conducted an in-depth analysis of over 250,000 posts published in the last 6 months to discover patterns and factors determining success or failure of content on X.

sections.subtitle: Five Key Factors Determining Reach on X
sections.content:
1. The first 15 minutes are crucial
Our research has shown that the X algorithm largely makes decisions about further content promotion based on engagement in the first 15 minutes after publication. Posts that didn't receive significant engagement during this period have only a 2% chance of later achieving wide reach.

2. "Cold start" is the biggest obstacle
The biggest challenge, especially for new accounts or content published by smaller brands, is the so-called "cold start". Without an initial impulse of engagement, even the most valuable content remains practically invisible.

3. Credibility signals are more important than ever
The X algorithm increasingly favors content published by accounts with high credibility levels. Key signals are account history, previous engagement levels, and most importantly - the quality of interactions with the content.

4. Invisible thematic bubbles
We discovered that X creates "invisible thematic bubbles", grouping users by interests and engagement history. Breaking through to new thematic bubbles is extremely difficult without a strategic approach.

5. Interaction multiplier effect
Our analyses showed a strong correlation between the diversity of interaction types and reach. Posts that generate diverse types of engagement (comments, retweets, likes, saves) have up to 600% greater reach than content with one dominant type of reaction.

sections.subtitle: How to Break the Reach Barrier?
sections.content:
Breaking these limitations requires a strategic approach and understanding of algorithm mechanisms. The key is:
- Strategic building of the first wave of engagement
- Creating content in a way that stimulates diverse interactions
- Systematic building of account credibility
- Use of advanced analytical tools for optimization
